document.docAuthor: Britz, Ralf, Anoop, V. K., Dahanukar, Neelesh & Raghavan, Rajeev
document.docTitle: Aenigmachanna gollum Britz & Anoop & Dahanukar & Raghavan 2019, new species
document.masterDocTitle: The subterranean Aenigmachanna gollum, a new genus and species of snakehead (Teleostei: Channidae) from Kerala, South India

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The subterranean Aenigmachanna gollum, a new genus and species of snakehead (Teleostei: Channidae) from Kerala, South India

figureCitation.captionText-0: FIGURE 1. Aenigmachanna gollum, alive, holotype, BNHS FWF 966, 90.2 mm SL, Oorakam, Malappuram, Kerala, India.
figureCitation.captionText-1: FIGURE 2. Aenigmachanna gollum, preserved, holotype, BNHS FWF 966, 90.2 mm SL, Oorakam, Malappuram, Kerala, India in lateral (A), dorsal (B), and ventral view (C).
figureCitation.captionText-2: FIGURE 3. Aenigmachanna gollum, preserved, paratype, BNHS FWF 967, 80.1 mm SL, Oorakam, Malappuram, Kerala, India, head in lateral (A), dorsal (B), and ventral view (C), sensory pores of head lateral-line marked by black dots. Abbreviations: aa anguloarticular pore; co circumorbital pores; d dentary pores; esc extrascapular pores; f frontal pores; po preopercular pores; pt posttemporal pores; pto pterotic pores.
figureCitation.captionText-3: FIGURE 4. Aenigmachanna gollum, preserved, holotype, BNHS FWF 966, 90.2 mm SL, details of body pigmentation. A, anterior body behind pectoral fin; B, posterior body at middle of caudal peduncle. Note increase in size of pigment free area at bases of scales in B.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Holotype .
BNHS FWF 966 , 90.2 mm SL, Oorakam , Malappuram , Kerala , India ( 11°03’52’’N and 76°01’00’’E ) collected by Ajeer on
3 September 2018
from a paddy field.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Paratype
. BNHS FWF 967 , 80.1 mm SL, same information as for holotype
.
Diagnosis. Same as for the genus.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 1. Selected measurements in mm of the holotype and paratype of
Aenigmachanna gollum
.

FIGURE 1.
Aenigmachanna gollum
, alive, holotype, BNHS FWF 966, 90.2 mm SL, Oorakam, Malappuram, Kerala, India.

FIGURE 2.
Aenigmachanna gollum
, preserved, holotype, BNHS FWF 966, 90.2 mm SL, Oorakam, Malappuram, Kerala, India in lateral (A), dorsal (B), and ventral view (C).

FIGURE 4.
Aenigmachanna gollum
, preserved, holotype, BNHS FWF 966, 90.2 mm SL, details of body pigmentation. A, anterior body behind pectoral fin; B, posterior body at middle of caudal peduncle. Note increase in size of pigment free area at bases of scales in B.

subSubSection.paragraph: Large scales covering top of head, small scales on postorbital area up to opercle (Figs. 2,3). 29 (10 + 19) predorsal scales. Comparatively small scales on anterior postcranial portion of body arranged slightly irregularly, with larger regularly arranged scales from level of anterior dorsal fin base posteriorly. 83–85 scales in lateral series plus 4 scales on caudal-fin base. 13 transverse scale rows.
Dorsal fin with 56–57 rays, anal fin with 43–44 rays, caudal fin with 7+7 principal caudal-fin rays and 1 dorsal and 1 ventral procurrent ray. Pectoral fin with 12 rays. Vertebrae 64.
Unfortunately, due to the rarity of the material we are unable to comment further on internal features.

Distribution.
Aenigmachanna gollum
is so far known only from the type locality (Figs. 5,6), a paddy field, but a third specimen has been reported from a well at the Village of Peringara near Tiruvalla ( 9°22’33” N and 76°33’00” E ), approximately 250 km south of the type locality.

Etymology. Named after Gollum, a character from J. R. R. Tolkien’s books ‘The Hobbit’ and ‘The Lord of the Rings’, a creature that went underground and during its subterranean life changed its morphological features. A noun in apposition. We propose the common name Gollum snakehead for this species.

Genetic analysis.
Aenigmachanna
showed high genetic divergence, with minimum and maximum raw genetic distances ranging from 15.8–24.2% in cox1 for the species of
Channa
, and with 20.4–22.2% in cox1 for species of
Parachanna
. Best partition scheme for the data was TNe+I+G4 for first two codon positions of cox1 (BIC = 18328.676, lnL = -8606.791, df=172) and TN+ASC+G4 for third codon position of cox1 (BIC = 18714.922, lnL = -8511.415, df=261). The maximum likelihood tree based on the best partition scheme ( Fig. 7 ) showed a deep divergence between
Aenigmachanna gollum
and the clades of
Parachanna
and
Channa
within Channoidei. Additional studies are needed to place
Aenigmachanna gollum
with confidence into a phylogenetic framework and to decide whether it is the sister group of
Parachanna
, of
Channa
or even of
Parachanna
plus
Channa
, as in the cox1 analysis ( Fig. 7 ).
